page.description: Report on the contents of a zip file.
page.syntax: File_List as C = ZipList(C zipfilename[,C Separator])

argument.name: zipfilename
argument.description: The name of the zip file to open.

argument.name: Separator
argument.description:
Information about how to format the output. You can use the following codes in the Format_String. All other characters in the Format_String will print as is. For example, to create a comma separated list of files in the zip file, you would use this format string: "n" + ","
To create list of filenames in the zip file with each name on its own line, you would use this format string: "n" + chr(13) + chr(10)

page.discussion: The FILE.ZIPLIST() method returns a character string with all of the files in Zip_Filename, formatted according to the Format_String.

section.title: Example
section.description: This script lists all of the files in a zip file to the Trace window.
